headache: A headache can have many causes, including tension, dehydration, or more serious conditions. Common treatments include rest, hydration, and over-the-counter pain relievers.
fever: Fever is a sign of infection or inflammation. Treatment depends on the underlying cause but may include fluids, rest, and antipyretics like acetaminophen.
hypertension: Hypertension (high blood pressure) is managed through lifestyle changes and medications such as ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, or diuretics.
diabetes: Diabetes mellitus requires blood sugar monitoring, insulin therapy or oral medications, and dietary management.
asthma: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition treated with inhalers, corticosteroids, and avoiding triggers.
